text: is a Japanese city in the mountains of Tochigi Prefecture.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Nikkō" Japan Encyclopedia, p. 714. == History == The Shinto shrine of Nikkō Tōshō-gū was completed in 1617. It is the burial place of Tokugawa Ieyasu.Nussbaum, "Tōshōgū" at p. 989. The shrines and temples of Nikkō have been recongized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.UNESCO, "Shrines and Temples of Nikkō"; retrieved 2012-9-10. ==Related pages == * List of World Heritage Sites in Japan == References == == Other websites == * Nikkō City website in English * Shrines and Temples of Nikkō Category:Cities in Tochigi Prefecture Category:World Heritage Sites in Japan
title: Nikkō
